name: Fort Vulgar
tagline: Trading and military outpost on the haunted shores of Lake Longmere
description: A teeming, ramshackle dock, along with a cluster of buildings, located at the point where Quogg's Creek flows into the haunted Lake Longmere. An old stone keep ringed with a dilapidated palisade stands on the cliffs above the docks, overlooking the lake.
atmosphere: Teeming and ramshackle with haunted undertones from the lake monster
inhabitants_description: The inhabitants of the keep itself, a handful of permanent residents around the docks, plus a transient population of traders, fishers, and barge-folk. It is common to see people from the realm to the north of Dolmenwood here.

governance.ruling_body: Sir Osric with the Vulgar Knights as law enforcement
governance.political_status: vassal of the Duke of Brackenwold
governance.notes: The Dockmaster and the Vulgar Knights act as law enforcement

religion.religious_practices: Sailors and river-folk tend to be devout sorts, happy to propitiate both the saints of the Pluritine Church and an assortment of folk-deities and spirits of the water

history: Keep Vulgular was originally constructed following the banishment of the Cold Prince, 850 years ago
With views from its towers across Lake Longmere to Hoarblight Keep (the erstwhile palace of the Cold Prince), it kept a watch for the fairy lord's return
First sightings of the lake monster Big Chook date back to 400 years ago, shortly after the coming of the Nag-Lord to Dolmenwood
Since the coming of the lake monster Big Chook, none of sound mind ply the waters of Lake Longmere
current_events: Trade between the Duchy of Brackenwold and the realm to the north principally flows via boats and barges along Quogg's Creek
Goods transported from the north are unloaded at Fort Vulgar onto wagons for transport on to Prigwort via the Fort Road
A number of Chookers (victims of Big Chook encounters) frequent Fort Vulgar, irresistibly drawn to shores where they may catch snippets of the monster's song
rumors_reference: See Rumours in Fort Vulgar, p446

special_features.name: Big Chook (Lake Monster)
special_features.description: A horrible lake monster that dwells in Lake Longmere, known for its mind-melting, cockerel-like wailings
special_features.mechanical_effect: Close encounters usually fatal; survivors often become wild-eyed obsessives called Chookers

special_features.name: Tentacle Tattoos
special_features.description: Many of the barge-folk and dock workers sport a tattoo of a black tentacle coiled around one forearm as a tradition and mark of pride

equipment_availability.notes: Vehicles and mounts are not generally available, though adventurers willing to pay 5 times the going rate may be able to persuade a merchant or trader to part with their transport

locations.name: Trade Square
locations.description: A cobblestoned square where goods are traded and unloaded from boats onto wagons and vice versa, via a set of creaky winches on the eastern side of the dock
locations.populace: Traders happy to sell goods to the occasional passing traveller

locations.name: Docks
locations.description: A widened bay at the river's mouth, with piers and mooring points for trade vessels to dock. Rope ladders lead 15′ up from the piers to land level
locations.exterior: Widened bay with piers and mooring points

services.name: Boat travel northwards
services.description: Passage on a boat to the old dock beside Avernal Lake

locations.name: Tax Tower
locations.description: A squat, two-storey tower of pale pinkish-white stone with a pointed, tiled roof, flying a black pennant
locations.interior: A feasting table, well-stocked pantry, and strongbox on the lower floor. Spartan lodgings on the upper floor
locations.exterior: Squat, two-storey tower of pale pinkish-white stone with pointed, tiled roof and black pennant
locations.populace: 1d4 knights and their squires during the day, 1d3 squires at night as lookouts
special_features: Knights practice combat manoeuvres on the riverbank

locations.name: The Chook's Nob
locations.description: An old wooden warehouse building with a tarred roof, now converted into a makeshift tavern and flophouse
locations.interior: A lofty warehouse space with clusters of stools carelessly scattered throughout. No tables. The place is constantly filled to the brim with pipe-smoke
locations.exterior: Old wooden warehouse building with tarred roof, deck with barrels for tables overlooking the docks
locations.populace: Rough barge-folk arm-wrestling and singing raucous sea shanties. The occasional merchant or trader

services.name: Lodgings
services.notes: Other guests must sleep on common room floor

services.name: Dockmaster's marmalade
services.description: Jars of sour crab apple jam, sweetened with lashings of honey badger slime

services.name: Crabble
services.description: Wince-inducingly sour crab apple cider fermented in the inn's cellars

services.name: Tattoos
services.description: Traditional tentacle tattoo or custom designs
services.cost: Free for traditional tentacle, 5gp+ for other designs

special_features: Green, scaly tentacle sign oozing purple blood

locations.name: Dockmaster's Cottage
locations.description: The only lovingly maintained building in Fort Vulgar. The residence of the dockmaster, Wiglow Bogleman, and her family is a homely, thatched cottage with rustic roses rambling up its sides
locations.exterior: Homely, thatched cottage with rustic roses rambling up its sides
locations.atmosphere: Well-maintained and homely, looking completely out of place
special_features: Only lovingly maintained building in Fort Vulgar

locations.name: Chapel of St Dougan
locations.description: A tall, narrow church made of vertical wooden posts with a sloping slate roof. Set atop a hill overlooking the docks, the chapel can be seen from all vantage points in Fort Vulgar
locations.interior: A windy, austere space with rickety, unornamented pews lined up before a monolithic altar of black stone. Upon the altar stands an unassuming wooden statue of the obscure minor saint, Dougan the Incredulous
locations.exterior: Tall, narrow church of vertical wooden posts with sloping slate roof, weathered door of black-lacquered oak with desiccated apple cores nailed upon it
locations.populace: God-fearing barge-folk, come to meekly pray for luck on their journeys and forgiveness of their sins

services.name: Prayer blessing
services.description: Characters praying may receive the blessing of St Dougan: the ability to cast Detect Disguise
services.notes: See Shrines, p22 and Uncommon Spells, p454

locations.name: Soured Orchard
locations.description: Old, unmaintained copses of pear and apple trees, now twisted and hunchbacked. In the autumn, they bear sour fruits, which locals gather
locations.populace: Locals gathering sour fruits in autumn
special_features: Blood-red worms with tiny human-like mouths writhing among roots
secrets: Anyone touching the worms must Save Versus Doom or be afflicted with sickness for 1d3 days

locations.name: Fort Palisade
locations.description: A ramshackle wooden palisade surrounding Keep Vulgular and its grounds. The palisade is in dire need of reinforcement and, in its current state, would provide little protection against concerted attack
locations.exterior: Ramshackle wooden palisade with turreted gatehouse and portcullis
special_features: Turreted gatehouse with portcullis, usually kept open during the day

locations.name: Keep Vulgular
locations.description: An old, crumbling castle of great stone blocks, partly clad in ivy. The chequered banner of House Brackenwold flies proudly from the highest gable. Its tall towers and high vantage point afford the keep excellent views across Lake Longmere
locations.interior: Frigid, dusty halls and chambers clad with moth-eaten tapestries, faded military maps, and damp carpets. The excess of side-doors, cramped connecting passages, and jumbled stacks of crates lends the place a bewildering, maze-like quality
locations.exterior: Old, crumbling castle of great stone blocks, partly clad in ivy with chequered banner of House Brackenwold
locations.populace: Sir Osric the Gaunt, five mounted knights, their squires and families, and a small retinue of boatmen and domestic servants
locations.atmosphere: Crumbling but proud castle with maze-like interior

services.name: Guest lodgings
services.description: Sumptuous (if somewhat dusty and ageing) suites
services.notes: For well-to-do merchants, Church/noble affiliates, or those bringing news from the Nagwood

locations.name: Fort Road
locations.description: A well-maintained, much-frequented trade road that leads to Prigwort, past the ruins of the Abbey of St Clewyd

locations.name: Creek Path
locations.description: A little-used hunter's trail leading into the depths of the forest, through the western edge of the Nagwood, and, eventually, north to the accursed Table Downs

npcs.name: Wiglow Bogleman
npcs.title: Dockmaster
npcs.description: A human woman in her fifties with long, straggling hair, a portly frame, and many missing teeth
npcs.dress: Sports a threadbare purple skullcap and clutches a cudgel topped with a carved wooden fist
demeanor: Habitually casts worried glances at the lake
npcs.mannerisms: Clutches a cudgel topped with a carved wooden fist
npcs.speech: Barely comprehensible rustic burr laced with official-sounding nautical terms
desires: The capture of Captain Snarkscorn and his cronies, who are hunting honey badgers in the region to near extinction

npcs.name: Brewigg Shankwolde
npcs.title: Chook's Nob Proprietor
npcs.description: A burly shorthorn woman with coarse, ginger fur, eyes of unusual deep red, foot-long chin-locks, and one fang-like tooth
npcs.dress: Keeps one forearm shaved, proudly revealing the tattooed tentacle coiling around it
npcs.mannerisms: Eyes guests suspiciously but is eager to talk to outsiders
npcs.speech: Strongly Gaffe-accented, frequent pauses while she gathers her thoughts
desires: News from the High Wold (her land of origin)

npcs.name: Father Edgar Drabe
npcs.title: Vicar of Fort Vulgar
npcs.description: A bald, chubby human man in his forties, with dull brown eyes hiding behind tiny spectacles
npcs.speech: Droning monologues punctuated with bursts of nervous laughter
desires: A post in a more glamorous, cultured locale

npcs.name: Sir Osric "the Gaunt" Hazelmire
npcs.title: Level 9 Knight
npcs.description: A human man renowned as the heartiest, most robust, reddest-faced man in the duke's service (his epithet is ironic). His height and the curl of his moustaches are equally famed
demeanor: Cranes his neck forward and stares when awaiting an answer
npcs.mannerisms: Cranes his neck forward and stares when awaiting an answer
desires: The head of the crookhorn Captain Snarkscorn, whose minions harry the river trade along Quogg's Creek
To be granted free rein to hunt crookhorns in the woods
The hand of Lady Mulbreck, whom he has admired from afar for years

entries.description: Dockmaster Bogleman laden with baskets of crab apples or freshly trapped honey badgers
Father Drabe chasing after hand-lettered scriptural verses, blown away by a capricious wind
1d3 knights arguing with a boatman about the taxable value of his wares
1d3 merchants looking to hire caravan guards. Offering 5gp per person to Castle Brackenwold
A toothless old Chooker, prophesying doom for all mortals in the insatiable belly of Big Chook
1d3 crookhorns snoop around in the shadows
2d6 barge-folk prancing drunkenly on the lakeside cliffs, shouting "come and get us Chookie!"
1d4+1 Chookers circle around passersby, making aggressive clucking and cock-a-doodle-do noises
A knight in the service of Lady Harrowmoor charging to the keep, bringing tidings of a force of crookhorns amassing at the ruined abbey (hex 0906)
2d6 zombies, riddled with blood-red worms, emerge from the soil of the soured orchard and go hunting for live brains
The cockerel-like wailings of Big Chook echo across the lake. Chookers rejoice; others rush indoors

monsters.name: Blood-red Worms
monsters.description: Unwholesome blood-red worms writhing among the roots of the trees. They are eyeless but have tiny, human-like mouths and tongues

special_abilities.name: Sickness
special_abilities.description: Anyone touching the worms must Save Versus Doom or be afflicted with sickness for 1d3 days (–2 to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws)
